bioghist.p: William Phelps Thompson (b. 1918), was elected Moderator of the General Assembly of the United Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A. in 1965. The next year, he was elected stated clerk of the General Assembly. He was a key leader in the merger of several Reformed Church groupings into the World Alliance of Reformed Churches, and served as the Alliance's president from 1970 to 1977. From 1975 to 1978, he served as president of the National Council of Churches of Christ in the USA.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials related to various committees and divisions of the National Council of Churches of Christ, including the General Assembly, the General Policy and Strategy Committee, the Division of International Affairs, the Division of Christian Unity, the General Administration, the Broadcasting and Film Commission, and a number of others. Materials date from 1954 to 1967, and include minutes, reports, policy statements, memoranda, budgets, and newsletters. Reports address various topics within the church and larger social issues, including civil rights, apartheid, the war in Vietnam, and immigration.
